1.title: The Pilot: "Guess Who's Coming to Dinner?"
1.plot: Nate returns home from his missionary trip in Africa with a new bride - Mia, A fun-loving hip hop dancer, who happens to be white. Everyone, including Mia, struggles with how she fits into this Godly family. Meanwhile Genesis struggles with abstaining from "relations" with her ultra-conservative fiancé, Keith.

2.title: Mama, I Wanna Sing
2.plot: Luke and Mia bond while Nate is constantly off running errands for his mother. But when Luke is learning more about Mia than Nate, Nate realizes he has to tell his mother there's another woman in his life who takes priority over her now. Genesis meets a hot musician, Devin (Keith Robinson), who has his own band at The Spot. Even though she knows her father disapproves, Genesis sneaks out to sing secular music with Devin's band. Keith lets his jealousy get the best of him and lets her secret slip out to William.

3.title: To Be or Not to Be Yourself
3.plot: The family prepares for the church's annual Youth Weekend. When William vetoes Luke's involvement, Nate ambushes them into a family counseling session with a therapist (Tommy Ford). Mia helps Carolyn with her youth girl's group, but the girls end up gravitating to Mia's realness more than Carolyn. Genesis enjoys her alter ego "Geni Fierce," when she puts on one of Mia's wigs.

4.title: The S-Word
4.plot: Genesis finally faces the truth about her feelings for Keith and calls off the engagement. And Carolyn must face the truth that the girls in her Chastity Ministry may need to hear more about the sex than she's comfortable discussing.

5.title: Breaking Up Blues
5.plot: Mia looks forward to being a good big sister by helping Genesis get over her break-up with Keith. Genesis insists she's fine. But when a busy-body deacon (Buddy Lewis) confronts her about her bad behavior, Genesis seeks comfort in one of Luke's "medicinal" pastries. Meanwhile, Carolyn plots to mend the relationship between William and Luke by cleaning out the attic.

6.title: Sunday Dinner Debacle
6.plot: The family rallies around a big dinner when William has a health scare that turns out to be indigestion. Mia's flamboyant mom (Mary Ann Hermansen) comes for a visit and outs a big secret about Mia during dinner. When Keith shows up to dinner with a date (Caryn Ward Ross), Genesis is finally able to see her own faults in their relationship. Luke takes Grandpa Roy out on a playdate that goes terribly awry.

7.title: Tea-Ball
7.plot: Mia tries to prove herself by volunteering to host a tea for some discerning ladies (Kym Whitley) at the church. Everything falls apart when Nate's friends end up crashing her tea party to watch a football game. Carolyn hires a nurse (Jackee Harry) for Grandpa Roy, who insists he can take care of himself. Genesis goes on a date with Devin (Keith Robinson) only to learn that things aren't always what they seem.

8.title: A Friend in Need
8.plot: Nate does a favor for his clingy friend, Chris (Deon Richmond), who Nate has been neglecting because he's too busy. But when the favor backfires, Nate has to decide if it's time to let go of some of his irresponsible friendships from childhood. Meanwhile, Carolyn enlists Mia's help with the church's dance team and it doesn't go well. Luke tries to get everyone to listen to his new self-produced CD, but no one has time.

imdb.plot outline: One Love follows the hilarious adventures of Pastor William and Carolyn Winters the first family of Mt. Sinai church. Together for thirty years, they've led their congregation as perfect role models, but when their adult children begin to navigate relationships of their own, they have to find a balance between sharing their wisdom and letting them learn from their own humorous mistakes.
imdb.title: One Love
plot: _One Love_ (qv) follows the hilarious adventures of Pastor William and Carolyn Winters the first family of Mt. Sinai church. Together for thirty years, they've led their congregation as perfect role models, but when their adult children begin to navigate relationships of their own, they have to find a balance between sharing their wisdom and letting them learn from their own humorous mistakes.::Phillip Brown
